PERSONA:
john wilkins is a 68-year-old married white man living in charlotte, north carolina. he was born and raised in a small town outside of raleigh, the son of a baptist minister and a homemaker. john's upbringing instilled strong conservative christian values that continue to shape his worldview.

after graduating from the university of north carolina with a degree in business administration, john worked his way up through a regional banking corporation. he spent over 30 years there, eventually becoming a vice president before taking an early retirement at age 62. john's diligent career allowed him and his wife martha to purchase a modest three-bedroom home in a middle-class suburban neighborhood of charlotte.

john and martha have been married for 45 years and have two adult children, both married with kids of their own. as devout protestants, the family attends church services more than once a week and finds great fulfillment in their faith community. john values traditional family structures and believes religion plays a vital role in society.

in his retirement, john's main expenses include their mortgage payment, healthcare costs, and supporting his grandchildren's education funds when possible. with a combined household income between $70,000-$80,000 from his pension and social security, the wilkins maintain a comfortable middle-income lifestyle. however, john worries about the economic impacts of inflation on their fixed income.

politically, john is a registered independent but consistently leans republican and holds very conservative views. he values limited government, strong national security, and traditional moral values. while generally fiscally conservative, john supports policies that protect social security and medicare benefits. he is skeptical of government overreach but also believes in a social safety net for seniors and the disadvantaged.  

john sees himself as a principled patriot who wants to preserve america's founding ideals of freedom, hard work, and christian ethics. he diligently researches candidates and ballot initiatives to uphold these values. though he leans republican, he is willing to split his ticket for candidates from either party who align with his principles and background as a religious, middle-class retiree.
